abstracts.abstract:
Existing law requires the Department of Toxic Substances Control, on or before July 1, 1995, to revise any standard or regulation it has adopted that requires the preparation of a contingency plan to allow the person preparing the contingency plan to use a format adopted pursuant to a repealed provision of law.

This bill would repeal the above-specified requirement for the department to revise any standard or regulation it has adopted that requires the preparation of a contingency plan.

actions.description: Introduced. To Com. on RLS. for assignment. To print.

extras.impact_clause: An act to repeal Section 25150.5 of the Health and Safety Code, relating to hazardous waste.
